alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 30 at 8:33PM CDT until November 01 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Monday was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 11.2 feet Monday, November 06. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
